data-science-projects.title: Sleep State Prediction
data-science-projects.description: Kaggle Competition: This project focuses on developing a model for sleep event detection using wrist-worn accelerometer data. The goal is to accurately identify sleep onset and wake periods.

data-science-projects.title: Health Insurance Costs
data-science-projects.description: The ultimate goal is to develop predictive models that can estimate medical insurance costs based on these factors. The project explores the relationship between personal attributes, geographic factors, and their impact on medical insurance charges.

data-science-projects.title: Stroke Prediction
data-science-projects.description: This project focuses on developing a machine learning model for predicting the likelihood of stroke events based on 11 clinical features. The dataset used for this analysis is the Stroke Prediction Dataset, which includes essential information to predict whether a patient is likely to experience a stroke.

data-science-projects.title: Heart Attack Analysis & Prediction
data-science-projects.description: This project is centered around the development of a machine learning model for predicting the likelihood of a heart attack based on various medical parameters.

data-science-projects.title: Sales Prediction
data-science-projects.description: This project seeks to predict and visually represent the upcoming 6 months of total sales by leveraging historical trends, while also allowing for adjustments that take into account both past sales patterns and external environmental factors.

data-science-projects.title: Kickstarter
data-science-projects.description: This project focuses on developing predictive models for Kickstarter campaigns, aiming to forecast project success or failure based on various factors. The dataset spans a diverse range of Kickstarter projects, providing valuable insights for creators and backers.

data-science-projects.title: Diabetes Onset
data-science-projects.description: This project aims to develop a machine learning model to predict the likelihood of diabetes onset in patients using a Diabetes Database. The dataset comprises various medical predictor variables.

data-science-projects.title: YouTube EDA
data-science-projects.description: This project aims to provide the music agency with valuable insights into the factors influencing the likelihood of their music videos becoming trending on YouTube.

experimental-research-projects.title: Maternal Immune Support: Enhancing the Defenses of the Baby after Pregnancy
experimental-research-projects.description: Mothers pass immune cells to their babies during pregnancy, enhancing fetal immune development and providing protection against infections in early life. Higher numbers of these maternal immune cells correlate with increased resilience against infections, shedding light on a new dimension of maternal-fetal immune transfer that goes beyond antibodies, potentially influencing the newborn’s health and immunity.

experimental-research-projects.title: How the First COVID-19 Wave Influenced Early Motherhood in Northern Germany
experimental-research-projects.description: Despite no significant changes in depression and anxiety, mothers in Northern Germany expressed higher dissatisfaction with the maternal role during the first COVID-19 wave. This study highlights potential influences of pandemic conditions on everyday life.

experimental-research-projects.title: Impact of COVID-19 Conditions on Infants and Maternal Mental Health
experimental-research-projects.description: Mothers in Northern Germany reported more sleeping and crying problems in infants born during the COVID-19 pandemic. The findings suggest a lasting impact on infant and maternal well-being, emphasizing the need for targeted peripartum and pediatric care.

experimental-research-projects.title: Nurturing Minds: How Mom’s Cells Guide Healthy Brain Development
experimental-research-projects.description: Maternal cells transferred during pregnancy play a vital role in shaping the developing brain. These cells unique markers, regulate microglia (brain immune cells), and contribute to the maturation of neural circuits, ultimately influencing lifelong brain functions and behaviour. This reveals that the transfer of these cells is not just a byproduct of pregnancy but are active participants in creating a foundation for optimal brain health.

experimental-research-projects.title: Maternal Transfer of Pathogen-Specific T Cells Boosts Neonatal Immunity in Mice
experimental-research-projects.description: This study reveals the transfer of pathogen-specific T cells from mother to fetus in mice during pregnancy, showcasing the potential of maternal microchimeric cells to enhance neonatal immunity. The findings emphasize the broader scope of maternally-derived passive immunity beyond antibodies.

experimental-research-projects.title: Predicting Early Respiratory Infections and Childhood Asthma via Fetal Lung Growth
experimental-research-projects.description: This study demonstrates that enhanced fetal lung growth, monitored through ultrasound during pregnancy, is associated with a lower risk of early-life respiratory infections and asthma at five years. Accurate machine-learning models based on fetal lung growth effectively predict these risks, emphasizing the value of sonographic monitoring for anticipating childhood respiratory health issues.
